H0.text: Which is the heaviest metal. Lead

H1.text: Which is the heaviest metal. Mercury

H2.text: Which is the heaviest metal. Tungsten

H3.text: Which is the heaviest metal. Osmic

A4.text: Osmium—the densest known metal—has a density of 22.59 g/cm3, nearly twice that of lead.

A5.text: Lead has a density of 11.34 g/cm3, greater than that of common metals such as iron (7.87 g/cm3), copper (8.93 g/cm3), and zinc (7.14 g/cm3).

A6.text: Tungsten has a density of 19.254 g/cm3, comparable with that of uranium and gold, and much higher (about 1.7 times) than that of lead.
